attributes.action: Prohibit AI from Training on UK music without permission and fair compensation.
attributes.additional_details: Musicians and composers depend on royalties more than ever, especially as live music revenues have declined since COVID. Allowing AI systems to learn from their work without consent or pay undermines their creative rights and livelihoods. Music is not just data—it is the unique and often recognisable expression of individual artistry, and it should be protected from exploitation by emerging technologies.
attributes.background: As well as prohibiting AI developers from using UK copyrighted music for training without permission and fair cpmpensation, the government should also develop clear guidelines on how AI may interact with protected music content in a way that supports innovation while upholding creators’ rights.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign the following petitions, which call for similar action:

Ban AI companies from using music streaming to train AI
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/715896

Ban the use of generative 'AI' in all creative sectors
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/704291
